title: 112_s3581
content: MODIFICATIONS TO CARBON DIOXIDE SEQUESTRATION CREDIT. The amendment to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code sets limitations on the credit allowed for qualified carbon dioxide captured by carbon capture equipment at a qualified facility. The national limitation is set at 75,000,000 metric tons of qualified carbon dioxide. The amendment to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code establishes a national limitation of 75,000,000 metric tons of qualified carbon dioxide for carbon capture projects. The Secretary will establish procedures for allocating this limitation to projects and certifying them by July 1, 2013. Each applicant must submit an application for allocation under this subsection. Each applicant for an allocation under this subsection must submit an application to the Secretary following established terms and conditions. The Secretary will prioritize applications based on the date received, giving higher priority to earlier submissions. Applications received before the specified date will be considered as if received on that date. The Secretary prioritizes applications based on the date received, giving higher priority to earlier submissions. For applications received on the same date, priority is given to those concurrently applying for certification. Projects with an earlier construction commencement date are also given higher priority. Tonnage allocation is based on the amount requested and the rank of the application until the available tonnage is exhausted. The Secretary prioritizes applications based on the date received, giving higher priority to earlier submissions and those concurrently applying for certification. Projects with an earlier construction commencement date are also given higher priority. Tonnage allocation is based on the amount requested and the rank of the application until the available tonnage is exhausted. Projects may retain their ranking and be eligible for forfeited or recaptured tonnage. The Secretary may not allocate more than the projected amount of qualified carbon dioxide to any project. The text chunk discusses the allocation of carbon dioxide captured at qualified facilities under a project, with specific conditions for disposal and reduction for prior credits. Certification is required for credits to be allowed. The text chunk outlines the certification process required for projects using carbon capture equipment to capture qualified carbon dioxide at a qualified facility before being eligible for credits under subsection (a). Each project allocated a portion of the national limitation must submit an application for certification to the Secretary within specific timeframes. The regulations and procedures must be established by the construction start date. The term 'construction start date' refers to when significant work begins or when 5% of the project cost is spent. The Secretary can revoke certification for inaccurate representations. The Secretary can revoke certification if an applicant makes a materially inaccurate representation regarding the project or fails to timely place carbon capture equipment in service. Reallocation may occur if certification is revoked. The Secretary can revoke certification for inaccurate representations or failure to place carbon capture equipment. Reallocation of national limitation is done if certification is revoked or if a taxpayer fails to obtain certification for a project. The Secretary must publicly disclose any allocation, certification, revocation, or change in project ranking within 30 days. The Secretary can revoke certification for inaccurate representations or failure to place carbon capture equipment. Reallocation of national limitation is done if certification is revoked or if a taxpayer fails to obtain certification for a project. The Secretary must publicly disclose any allocation, revocation, or change in project ranking within 30 days. Amendments are made to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code regarding carbon capture equipment and annual reporting requirements. The definition of carbon capture equipment is amended to include equipment that captures and pressurizes qualified carbon dioxide. The tax credit is allowed to taxpayers who perform carbon capture activities. The tax credit is allowed to taxpayers who capture and dispose of qualified carbon dioxide in accordance with specific requirements. The tax credit under section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code allows for the disposal of qualified carbon dioxide in compliance with specified regulations. Amendments are made to sections 45Q(a) and 45Q(c) of the Code to align with the credit provisions. Rules regarding credit recapture are also updated in section 45Q(d). The amendments made to section 45Q(d) of the Internal Revenue Code specify that regulations issued shall only apply to qualified carbon dioxide captured or disposed of after the filing date. These changes are effective for carbon dioxide captured after July 31, 2013.
